forum_post.title: Oilahuasca - Expanding on the Theory
forum_post.author: OnlineAngelicalist
forum_post.thread_context: Posted to update 10+ year old threads on the topic with new research
forum_post.favorite_quote: Some people have reported Psychedelic effects from Mixing just Coffee, Almond, Cinnamon, Vanilla and Nutmeg
forum_post.full_post_text:
There are several Threads here about this already but they are all 10 Years Old and more, so I wanted to Share a Discussion I had with Claude.ai Yesterday, which confirms the Theory and even expands on it. The Original Theory or Discovery was made by someone with the Username 'Ron69' on various Websites, he says he stumbled upon CYP450 Enzyme Research when studying the way Nutmegs Psychoactive effect Works, on PubMed. Most information available Today is on the Herbpedia Wikidot 'Oilahusca Activation' Page.

But this Discussion I had with Claude.ai Yesterday Helps to Confirm the Theory, and actually Expand it. It is a lot to Read but it adds a lot to the Theory, using information provided by Dr. Sasha Shulgin in PIHKAL and Things I asked the Artificial Intelligence to Research during the Discussion.

My Favorite Quote about Oilahuasca for Years now has been,
'Some people have reported Psychedelic effects from Mixing just Coffee, Almond, Cinnamon, Vanilla and Nutmeg'

moderator_warning.text: Warning this discussion is speculative and involves compounds that are known to be harmful with little recreational or shamanistic benefit. It is based on content by 69ron a known pusher of pseudoscience and misinformation. This misinformation is now being regurgitated by AI and referenced as factual science by OP. AI is not god and content it generates is not fact.
moderator_warning.response: The research includes PubMed citations (PMID references) that independently verify the CYP450 mechanisms. The theory may be speculative but the underlying enzyme science is documented in peer-reviewed literature.

forum_criticism.post: Please don't fucking spank down a ton of nutmeg. There are many, many, better, safer options.
forum_criticism.response_from_op: Actually the Original Theory doesn't require 'A bunch of Nutmeg' but is more about using the Essential Oils like Elemicin. Also, the Expanded Theory here includes adding Isomers of the Original Essential Oils like Sarisan, Croweacin, and Isoelemicin

forum_thread_full_context.clarification_about_essential_oils: The theory is NOT about eating large amounts of nutmeg, but about strategic use of specific essential oils and CYP450 modulation

entheogen_etymology.context: Post referencing Dr. Carl Ruck, co-inventor of the term 'Entheogen'
entheogen_etymology.coined: 1979 by Carl A. P. Ruck, Jeremy Bigwood, Danny Staples, Richard Evans Schultes, Jonathan Ott and R. Gordon Wasson

etymology.entheos: Greek - 'full of the god, inspired, possessed' - root of English 'enthusiasm'
etymology.meaning: A drug that causes one to become inspired or experience feelings of inspiration, often in a religious or spiritual manner

entheogen_etymology.why_coined: Replacement for 'hallucinogen' (associated with delirium/insanity) and 'psychedelic' (associated with 1960s pop culture and psychosis)
entheogen_etymology.connection_to_oilahuasca: Ancient peoples may have been using enzyme modulation similarly to how MAOI/DMT use was discovered by tribes (e.g., Ubulawu, possibly Xhosa Tea, 'Magic' mixtures containing Parsley)
